definition: few/less/to lack/to be missing/to stop (doing sth)/seldom
will/shall/to use/to take/to checkmate/just a short while ago/(introduces object of main verb, used in the same way as 把[ba3])

sentences.english: A. The ( Major, major) General's (Major, major) is history.
sentences.chinese: 那陆军少将的主修科目是历史。

sentences.english: The Rear Admiral is survived by his wife Geeta and a daughter and a son.
sentences.chinese: 这位海军少将身后留有妻子吉塔和一双儿女。

sentences.english: That prompted a retort from Rear Adm.
sentences.chinese: 这番话激起了一个少将的反驳。

sentences.english: A general officer ranking above a major general and below a full general.
sentences.chinese: 一个军衔位于少将之上和大将之下的将官。

sentences.english: Major General Peng Guangqian defines current Sino-US relations as a "smart war".
sentences.chinese: 彭光谦少将把当前的中美关系比作一场“智斗”。

sentences.english: In early 1943, Chennault was promoted to major general.
At the same time too little time spent for planning for the long- term issues will not help reaching the goals.
sentences.chinese: 同时用于长期计划的时间消耗太少将难以达到目标。

sentences.english: Dorko was evacuated to a US military hospital in Germany.
sentences.chinese: 少将已经被转移到德国的一家美国军事医院。

definition: high ranking officer in Chinese army/colonel
middle ranking officer in Chinese army/lieutenant colonel/commander
junior ranking officer in Chinese army/major/lieutenant commander
commander-in-chief/top military commander for a country or theater of operations
